attributes.action: force utilities, and companies in general, to compete effectively
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A Market Economy requires effective competition. It is obvious that even if there is no evidence of formal price-fixing this does not prove competition. Energy companies can still choose individually to behave non-competitively and follow others' prices up, rather than force them down. 

The same may be true for many products, for example spectacles and contact lenses and some foods. A conspiracy may be tacit rather than explicit.

The unseen hand of the market cannot work if it has been tied behind its back.

Ordering utility companies to reduce their prices by at least 15% would boost the economy and assist the housing market.
